name: Engaged session ratio (bounce rate)
description: Bounce rate, the reverse of engagement rate, reflects a single page session. These sessions happen when a customer visits certain page and closes it without clicking on any link or doing any action. A too low or too high bounce rate on your website or a specific web page might indicate a measurement issue.

constants.name: lowerThreshold
constants.description: lower bound to engagement rate in percentages

constants.name: upperThreshold
constants.description: upper bound to engagement rate in percentages

blocks.description: It checks if the engagement rate on any page is not between 10% and 95%, if not, this test fails.
blocks.passMessage: Engagement rate is within expected bounds ${lowerThreshold} % and ${upperThreshold} %
blocks.failMessage: Engagement rate is not between ${lowerThreshold} % and ${upperThreshold} % (actual value is ${(totalEngagementRate*100).toFixed(2)} %)
blocks.failHowtofix:
Following points should be checked:
1. Pageview is not duplicated
2. Pageview is triggered after on all pages
3. Event has correctly setup non-interaction.
